name: Standard Bearer
text: While choosing targets as part of casting a spell or activating an ability, your opponents must choose at least one Flagbearer on the battlefield if able.

editions.flavor: The standard was a rallying point for the army and a target for the enemy.

name: Standardize
text: Choose a creature type other than Wall. Each creature becomes that type until end of turn.

editions.flavor: At that point, the wizards' argument got a lot uglier.

name: Stand Firm
text: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

name: Standing Army
text: As long as you're standing, Standing Army has vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause it to tap.)

editions.flavor: They're the chair-men of the bored.

name: Standing Stones
text: {1}, {T}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

name: Standing Troops
text: Vigilance

editions.flavor: The less you have, the harder you fight for it.
The less you have, the harder you fight for it.
They fight so closely together a mouse couldn't slip past their guard.
The less you have, the harder you fight for it.

"Bant sentries were called the Angel Line. They never faltered, and they were ready to die defending their position."
—Elspeth
The less you have, the harder you fight for it.

name: Stand or Fall
text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, separate all creatures defending player controls into two piles. Only creatures in the pile of that player's choice can block this turn.

name: Standstill
text: When a player casts a spell, sacrifice Standstill. If you do, each of that player's opponents draws three cards.

editions.flavor: "Take your time."

"You learn a lot in no time when you're about to get your neck snapped."
—Dack Fayden

name: Stand Together
text: Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature and two +1/+1 counters on another target creature.

editions.flavor: Strange times make for strange allies.

name: Stangg
text: When Stangg enters the battlefield, create a legendary 3/4 red and green Human Warrior creature token named Stangg Twin. When Stangg leaves the battlefield, exile that token. When that token leaves the battlefield, sacrifice Stangg.

name: Star Compass
text:
Star Compass enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a basic land you control could produce.

editions.flavor: It doesn't point north. It points home.
It doesn't point north. It points home.

name: Starfall
text: Starfall deals 3 damage to target creature. If that creature is an enchantment, Starfall deals 3 damage to that creature's controller.

editions.flavor:
"The most brilliant stars are not born of Nyx."
—Rhexenor, Akroan flamespeaker

name: Starfield of Nyx
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return target enchantment card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
As long as you control five or more enchantments, each other non-Aura enchantment you control is a creature in addition to its other types and has base power and base toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

name: Starke
text: At the beginning of your draw step, you may draw an additional card. If you do, put a card from your hand on the bottom of your library.

editions.flavor: Starke believes in situational ethics—the situation determines the ethics. He's switched sides so often that he has become everyone's ally yet no one's friend. This former merchant of Rath accompanies the Weatherlight crew on their journey to his home world.

name: Starke of Rath
text: {T}: Destroy target artifact or creature. That permanent's controller gains control of Starke of Rath. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

editions.flavor:
"I know to whom I owe the most loyalty, and I see him in the mirror every day."
—Starke

"I know to whom I owe the most loyalty, and I see him in the mirror every day."
—Starke

name: Starlight
text: You gain 3 life for each black creature target opponent controls.

editions.flavor:
"Even in the darkest night
Stars and angels still shine bright."
—Onean children's rhyme
Stars are like coins dropped into the night: their light buys safe passage.

name: Starlight Invoker
text: {7}{W}: You gain 5 life.

editions.flavor: The Mirari glows in her eyes.
"The constellations form a tapestry of light that traces my people's broken history. Day and night, I feel their glittering presence calling me to weave the pattern whole."

name: Starlit Angel
text: Flying

editions.flavor: To soar as high as hope, to dive as swift as justice.

name: Starlit Sanctum
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{W}, {T}, Sacrifice a Cleric creature: You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.
{B}, {T}, Sacrifice a Cleric creature: Target player loses life equal to the sacrificed creature's power.

name: Starstorm
text:
Starstorm deals X damage to each creature.
Cycling {3} ({3}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.flavor: Ever since the disaster, the city's survivors viewed the star-strewn sky with dread.
Ever since the disaster, the city's survivors viewed the star-strewn sky with dread.
Ever since the disaster, the city's survivors viewed the star-strewn sky with dread.
Pardic barbarians didn't complain when the Order started blaming every crisis on the Cabal.

name: Startled Awake
text:
Target opponent puts the top thirteen cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
{3}{U}{U}: Put Startled Awake from your graveyard onto the battlefield transformed. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

name: Start Your Engines
text: Vehicles you control become artifact creatures until end of turn. Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Inventors from around the world have come to the Fair hoping their creations will fly, drive, or sail their way to a top prize.

name: Starved Rusalka
text: {G}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"No more wretched fate is there than to waste away. If you are slain, your ghost may at least avenge itself upon your killer. But what release is there for one slain by Time?"
—Ilromov, traveling storyteller

name: Stasis
text:
Players skip their untap steps.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Stasis unless you pay {U}.

name: Stasis Cell
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
{3}{U}: Attach Stasis Cell to target creature.

editions.flavor: The Simic created the cells to preserve their experiments. The Azorius put the cells to use on the guilty.
The Simic created the cells to preserve their experiments. The Azorius put the cells to use on the guilty.

name: Stasis Cocoon
text:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.

editions.flavor: Though the grip of a golem is strong, the grip of Auriok magic is far stronger.

name: Stasis Snare
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Stasis Snare enters the battlefield, exile target creature an opponent controls until Stasis Snare leaves the battlefield. (That creature returns under its owner's control.)

name: Statecraft
text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by creatures you control.

editions.flavor:
"Inside these walls, peace; outside, sharks. You choose."
—Saprazzan vizier

name: Static Orb
text: As long as Static Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than two permanents during their untap steps.

editions.flavor:
Time passes, time crawls;
Time doesn't move at all.
The warriors fought against the paralyzing waves until even their thoughts froze in place.
Reduction of energy and motion within the stasis field creates the illusion of slowed time.

name: Statute of Denial
text: Counter target spell. If you control a blue creature, draw a card, then discard a card.

editions.flavor: "Pyrotechnic activity of any sort is strictly prohibited. It is irrelevant that today is a holiday."

name: Staunch Defenders
text: When Staunch Defenders enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.

editions.flavor:
"Hold your position! Leave doubt for the dying!"
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

"Hold your position! Leave doubt for the dying!"
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

"Hold your position! Leave doubt for the dying!"
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

"Hold your position! Leave doubt for the dying!"
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

"The key to winning any fight is simply staying alive."
—The Southern Paladin
The key to winning any fight is simply staying alive.

name: Staunch-Hearted Warrior
text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Staunch-Hearted Warrior, put two +1/+1 counters on Staunch-Hearted Warrior.

editions.flavor: As soon as she faces a monster, she begins composing its epitaph.

name: Stave Off
text: Target creature gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Just a moment of perfect grace and sanctity is enough."
—Kal Lior, leonin elder

name: Staying Power
text: As long as Staying Power is in play, "until end of turn" and "this turn" effects don't end.

editions.flavor: Mongo's fleas no longer bothered him. But the family of goblins that had moved in behind his left ear was starting to get really irritating.

name: Steadfast Cathar
text: Whenever Steadfast Cathar attacks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"The most resolute soldiers will press forward in the face of overwhelming odds."
—Gideon Jura

name: Steadfast Guard
text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

editions.flavor: The Mercadians were prepared for the guard, but the guard was even more prepared for the Mercadians.
"Best leave your tongue in its yap-hole, Mercadian scum, for your silvered words and golden bribes do not sparkle so brightly outside your city."

name: Steadfastness
text: Creatures you control get +0/+3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Brute force wins the battles. Conviction wins the wars.
Brute force wins the battles. Conviction wins the wars.

name: Steady Progress
text:
Proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: "More of that strange oil . . . It's probably nothing."
"More of that strange oil . . . It's probably nothing."

name: Steal Artifact
text:
Enchant artifact
You control enchanted artifact.

name: Steal Enchantment
text:
Enchant enchantment
You control enchanted enchantment.

editions.flavor:
"Why should I flatter another with imitation when I can satisfy myself through possession?"
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Stealer of Secrets
text: Whenever Stealer of Secrets deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.

editions.flavor: The Dimir would hire her, if only they knew where she lived. The Azorius would condemn her, if only they knew her name.
The Dimir would hire her, if only they knew where she lived. The Azorius would condemn her, if only they knew her name.
www.MagicTheGathering.com

name: Steal Strength
text: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Another target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: With each grunt of pain from Haddad, Greel's grin widened.

name: Steam Augury
text: Reveal the top five cards of your library and separate them into two piles. An opponent chooses one of those piles. Put that pile into your hand and the other into your graveyard.

editions.flavor: Keranos is a fickle god, delivering punishment as readily as prophecy.
Keranos is a fickle god, delivering punishment as readily as prophecy.
Keranos is a fickle god, delivering punishment as readily as prophecy.

name: Steam Blast
text: Steam Blast deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.

editions.flavor: The viashino knew of the cracked pipes but deliberately left them unmended to bolster the rig's defenses.
The viashino knew of the cracked pipes but deliberately left them unmended to bolster the rig's defenses.

name: Steam Catapult
text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

editions.flavor: "You idiots! Turn it around! Turn it around!"
"You idiots! Turn it around! Turn it around!"

name: Steamclaw
text:
{3}, {T}: Exile target card from a graveyard.
{1}, Sacrifice Steamclaw: Exile target card from a graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"There's dead, and then there's dead dead."
—Steamclaw driver

name: Steamcore Weird
text: When Steamcore Weird enters the battlefield, if {R} was spent to cast Steamcore Weird, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: Like many Izzet creations, weirds are based on wild contradictions yet somehow manage to work.
Like many Izzet creations, weirds are based on wild contradictions yet somehow manage to work.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
editions.flavor: Like many Izzet creations, weirds are based on wild contradictions yet somehow manage to work.

name: Steamflogger Boss
text:
Other Rigger creatures you control get +1/+0 and have haste.
If a Rigger you control would assemble a Contraption, it assembles two Contraptions instead.

editions.flavor:
"Whip the Xs ! Pinch the Os!
What we're building, no one knows!"

name: Steam Frigate
text: Steam Frigate can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

editions.flavor:
"Is it merchants or is it pirates?"
"It's Talas—there's no difference."

name: Steam Spitter
text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
{R}: Steam Spitter gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Its belly produces a boiling-hot fluid it can spit as a weapon or spin slowly enough to freeze into a defensive web.

name: Steam Vents
text:
({T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool.)
As Steam Vents enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Steam Vents enters the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor: Crafted with genius, energized with madness.

name: Steam Vines
text:
Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it and Steam Vines deals 1 damage to that land's controller. That player attaches Steam Vines to a land of his or her choice.

name: Steelclad Serpent
text: Steelclad Serpent can't attack unless you control another artifact.

editions.flavor:
"From the highest towers to the deepest sea, all life must be touched by etherium."
—Lodus of the Ethersworn

name: Steelform Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control get +0/+1.

editions.flavor:
"Though the slivers may sometimes resemble us, they are not human. Anyone who fights them must remember this."
—Sarlena, paladin of the Northern Verge

name: Steel Golem
text: You can't cast creature spells.

editions.flavor:
"Although I would give my life to protect Gerrard, my conscience will not let me take another's. There are many who would not hesitate."
—Karn, silver golem

"Once you create perfection, what else is there to make?"
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist

name: Steel Hellkite
text:
Flying
{2}: Steel Hellkite gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{X}: Destroy each nonland permanent with converted mana cost X whose controller was dealt combat damage by Steel Hellkite this turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

name: Steeling Stance
text:
Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
Forecast — {W}, Reveal Steeling Stance from your hand: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)

name: Steel Leaf Paladin
text:
First strike
When Steel Leaf Paladin enters the battlefield, return a green or white creature you control to its owner's hand.

name: Steel of the Godhead
text:
Enchant creature
As long as enchanted creature is white, it gets +1/+1 and has lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
As long as enchanted creature is blue, it gets +1/+1 and can't be blocked.

name: Steel Overseer
text: {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on each artifact creature you control.

editions.flavor:
"The world is already run by all manner of machines. One day, they'll remind us of that fact."
—Sargis Haz, artificer
In an unusual foray into the humanoid form, Venand Kapur—known as the Gearherder—built this automaton to keep watch over his clockwork herds.

"The world is already run by all manner of machines. One day, they'll remind us of that fact."
—Sargis Haz, artificer

name: Steel Sabotage
text:
Choose one —
• Counter target artifact spell.
• Return target artifact to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"You are hopelessly obsolete, my brothers. Come and join the Great Work."
—Rhmir, Hand of the Augur

name: Steelshaper Apprentice
text: {W}, {T}, Return Steelshaper Apprentice to its owner's hand: Search your library for an Equipment card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: Theirs is a craft brought about by necessity, now raised to the level of art.

name: Steelshaper's Gift
text: Search your library for an Equipment card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: Some blades seek their own wielders.

name: Steel Wall
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)

editions.flavor:
"We sculpt the land into what we need—homes, armament, fortresses of war. Our strength comes not only from knowing, but from commanding the terrain."
—Raksha Golden Cub, leonin kha

"We sculpt the land into what we need—homes, armament, fortresses of war. Our strength comes not only from knowing, but from commanding the terrain."
—Raksha Golden Cub, leonin kha

name: Steely Resolve
text:
As Steely Resolve enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Creatures of the chosen type have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor: No one in Wirewood understands what is happening. They just know it's unnatural—and coming from Krosa.

name: Steeple Roc
text: Flying, first strike

editions.flavor:
"Sometimes it forgets to loosen its grip before taking flight. I lost my roof that way."
—Ecaban, Boros scout

name: Stench of Decay
text: Nonartifact creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"My lord, there is only so much I can do. This plague infests Krov worse than any other city."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest

"Disa is dead, and I am left. I shall allow no others to succumb to this pestilence."
—Kolbjörn, High Honored Druid

name: Stench of Evil
text: Destroy all Plains. For each land destroyed this way, Stench of Evil deals 1 damage to that land's controller unless he or she pays {2}.

name: Stenchskipper
text:
Flying
At the beginning of the end step, if you control no Goblins, sacrifice Stenchskipper.

editions.flavor:
"Many believe it to be the manifestation of all that is vile about the boggarts. I believe it should be avoided—from upwind, if possible."
—Cenn Deagan

name: Stensia
text:
Whenever a creature deals damage to one or more players for the first time each turn, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, each creature you control gains "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target player" until end of turn.

name: Stensia Banquet
text:
Stensia Banquet deals damage to target opponent equal to the number of Vampires you control.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"We can't win a war on an empty stomach, can we?"
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Stensia Bloodhall
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{3}{B}{R}, {T}: Stensia Bloodhall deals 2 damage to target player.

editions.flavor: The revelry ends when the supply of fresh ingenues runs dry.

name: Stensia Innkeeper
text: When Stensia Innkeeper enters the battlefield, tap target land an opponent controls. That land doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

editions.flavor: "The perils of the road, you say? Don't worry. You won't have to face those again."

name: Stensia Masquerade
text:
Attacking creatures you control have first strike.
Whenever a Vampire you control deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Madness {2}{R} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

name: Steppe Glider
text:
Flying, vigilance
{1}{W}: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains flying and vigilance until end of turn.

editions.flavor: It glides over the landscape. It also happens to be one.

name: Steppe Lynx
text: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, Steppe Lynx gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Nothing quickens the predator's blood like the unfamiliar scents of new hunting grounds and the mewling cries of new prey.

name: Sterling Grove
text:
Other enchantments you control have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
{1}, Sacrifice Sterling Grove: Search your library for an enchantment card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

name: Stern Constable
text: {T}, Discard a card: Tap target creature.

editions.flavor: "I'm sure you have a story. Everyone has a story. You can tell it to the bars."

name: Stern Judge
text: {T}: Each player loses 1 life for each Swamp he or she controls.

editions.flavor: "How to punish the guilty is up to the Ancestor. Deciding who merits such punishment is up to me."

name: Stern Marshal
text: {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

name: Stern Mentor
text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Stern Mentor is paired with another creature, each of those creatures has "{T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard."

name: Stern Proctor
text: When Stern Proctor enters the battlefield, return target artifact or enchantment to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"I preferred the harsh tutors—they made mischief all the more fun."
—Teferi, third-level student

Vigilance
